meanings.definition: A person who bequeaths personal property by will.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother was a generous legator, leaving each of us a special gift in her will.
meanings.sent2: The legators of the estate distributed the family heirlooms according to the will.
meanings.sent3: The legators decided to play a game where they pretended to be passing on imaginary treasures.
meanings.sent4: The legators' wills were like maps, guiding their loved ones to their final gifts.
meanings.sent5: The legators' bequests were like colorful threads weaving through the tapestry of family history.

meanings.definition: A person who leaves a legacy or bequest.
meanings.sent1: The community remembered the legators for their generous donations to the local school.
meanings.sent2: Legators often plan ahead to ensure their loved ones are taken care of after they're gone.
meanings.sent3: The legators' bequests were like surprise gifts waiting to be unwrapped by the recipients.
meanings.sent4: The legacy of the legators shone brightly in the hearts of those they helped.
meanings.sent5: The town celebrated the legators' memory with a beautiful memorial garden.

meanings.definition: A person who makes a bequest or will.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer helped the legators draft their wills to ensure their wishes were clear.
meanings.sent2: Legators carefully consider who will inherit their belongings when they are no longer here.
meanings.sent3: The legators joked that they were like modern-day treasure hunters, leaving clues in their wills.
meanings.sent4: The legators' bequests were like whispers of love carried on the wind.
meanings.sent5: The legators' wills were like time capsules, preserving their memories for future generations.
